dt: {bc}to take part in or experience something along with others
{bc}to have a portion (as of food or drink)

dt.t: were invited to {wi}partake{/wi} of a dinner

dt: {bc}to possess or share a certain nature or attribute

dt.t: the experience {wi}partakes{/wi} of a mystical quality
{wi}partake{/wi} in each other's sorrows and joys
adventurers who were willing to {wi}partake{/wi} his fortunes

pt: {sc}share{/sc} {sc}participate{/sc} {sc}partake{/sc} mean to have, get, or use in common with another or others. {sc}share{/sc} usually implies that one as the original holder grants to another the partial use, enjoyment, or possession of a thing.
{sc}participate{/sc} implies a having or taking part in an undertaking, activity, or discussion.
{sc}partake{/sc} implies accepting or acquiring a share especially of food or drink.

shortdef: to take part in or experience something along with others
to have a portion (as of food or drink)
to possess or share a certain nature or attribute
